data.title: Overview
data.text: Public protests in 2022 over economic crisis, fuel/food shortages, and governance concerns.
data.html: Public protests in 2022 responding to the economic crisis, shortages, and governance concerns. Major gathering points included Galle Face (GotaGoGama), with marches and demonstrations across Colombo and other districts.

data.title: Early April: Nationwide Protests
data.text: Initial large-scale gatherings and curfew announcements.
data.html:
• Spontaneous protests in Colombo and suburbs
  • Curfew periods announced/adjusted
  • Momentum grows toward a central camp

data.title: Galle Face – “GotaGoGama”
data.text: Protest village forms at Galle Face Green (Colombo).
data.html:
Protest village GotaGoGama established at Galle Face Green as a sustained, symbolic hub.

Facilities: tents, information desks, legal aid, medical tents.

data.title: June: Fuel/Power Pressure
data.text: Fuel queues, power cuts, and escalating demonstrations.
data.html: Escalation with extended fuel queues and power cuts; protest actions spread, participation widens.

data.title: July 9: Mass March in Colombo
data.text: Large crowds converge on central sites; major turning point.
data.html: July 9: Large crowds converge on central Colombo locations. A major turning point day with nationwide attention.
